main event: Observers from Dauphin and adjacent counties sighted an object in the sky, reported to be a meteor traveling from southeast to northwest.
interesting points: The object appeared to be approximately 25 inches in diameter and had a bluish-white light that turned to yellow., The last sighting occurred as it appeared to go below the hills across the Susquehanna River., All observers reported no sound associated with the object., The weather was clear with 7 miles visibility at the time of the sighting., At least two observers were case guards, suggesting reliability.
sighted object: an unidentified object in the sky, reported as probably a meteor
witness description: observers on the ground from Dauphin and adjacent counties
